meToolkit 0.1.0

Generate sample individual level data based upon some phewas results

simIndividualData.Rd

This function will take the results of a phewas study (most importantly a code, case and control numbers, and an OR) and simulate as many individual datapoints as you desire.

simIndividualData(phewas_results, num_patients, snp_prev)

Arguments

phewas_results

Phewas results. Needs a column code with the id of a given phecode, code_proportion: with the proportion of individuals that have the code in the entire population, and OR: the odds ratio of having a code given having the snp of interest.
num_patients

How many patients should be simulated.
snp_prev

The overall population prevalence of the snp you want to simulate.

Value

list with following components

snp_status

tibble with patient ID and snp status (snp)

phenotypes

wide tibble with an ID column and a column for each code provided in the phewas_resuts input. Cell values are if the patient had that given code.

Examples

simIndividualData(fake_phewas_results, 10, 0.15)
#> $snp_status
#> # A tibble: 10 x 2
#>    id      snp
#>    <chr> <int>
#>  1 r1        0
#>  2 r10       0
#>  3 r2        0
#>  4 r3        0
#>  5 r4        0
#>  6 r5        0
#>  7 r6        0
#>  8 r7        0
#>  9 r8        0
#> 10 r9        0
#>
